title: Balance Innovation with Legacy API Support
task: Develops a new ALFRED app to optimize clinical workflows
summary: As a developer, I want to disable legacy APIs only after I am confident that all my applications have fully migrated, so I can maintain system stability for users while progressively implementing new features.

title: Flexible API Integration with Legacy Disable
task: Utilizes ALFREDs open APIs for integration
summary: As a full-stack developer, I want to integrate ALFRED's open APIs and disable legacy APIs after migration to ensure my development process remains efficient, secure, and aligned with modern coding standards while supporting the needs of healthcare providers.
cluster: Balance Innovation with Legacy API Support

title: Support Asynchronous Workflows with AI Coding
task: Implements asynchronous workflows and AI-assisted coding
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to implement asynchronous workflows and leverage AI-assisted coding to accelerate development and maintain full control over design, ensuring secure, scalable app integration that aligns with my preference for simplified, modular backend architectures and strict privacy constraints.

title: Balance Innovation with Device Compatibility
task: Balances innovative features with compatibility for older devices
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to leverage state-of-the-art technologies including smart voice guidance and responsive UI, while ensuring my apps perform efficiently on older devices and meet strict security and accessibility standards, so that I can deliver innovative yet compatible solutions to healthcare providers.

title: Disable Legacy APIs Post-Migration
task: Disables legacy APIs after migration to avoid disruptions
summary: As a full-stack developer, I want to disable legacy APIs after migration to simplify my development workflow, enhance security, and focus on building modern, efficient healthcare applications for older adults and caregivers.

title: Manage and Analyze Medical Staff Feedback
task: Receives and analyzes feedback from medical staff via developer channels
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to receive and analyze feedback from medical staff through developer channels that integrate seamlessly with my remote, asynchronous workflow and allow me to prioritize improvements effectively without disrupting my coding process.

title: Disable Proactive Voice Prompts
task: Debates adding proactive voice prompts to assist less tech-savvy users
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to disable proactive voice prompts in clinical integration features so that I can maintain full control over the user experience and ensure my applications remain focused, accessible, and non-intrusive according to my development principles.

title: Minimize UI Distractions for Clinical Apps
task: Considers potential for overwhelming busy professionals with UI elements
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want ALFRED to allow me precise customization of UI elements and notifications so that I can build clinical apps that align with my design control preferences and reduce distractions for end users.
cluster: Explicit Voice Command Activation for Privacy Control

title: Ensure App Usability and Accessibility Compliance
task: Strives to meet usability and accessibility standards in app design
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to ensure my app meets usability and accessibility standards that align with my technical goals and development constraints, so I can deliver inclusive, efficient, and secure solutions tailored to the real needs of older adults and caregivers.

title: Balance Innovation with Workflow Simplicity
task: Manages tension between innovation and user demand for simplicity
summary: As a full-stack healthcare app developer, I want to disable legacy APIs after migration and control proactive voice prompts according to my development preferences, so I can create efficient, innovative applications that fit my workflow while ensuring usability for clinicians.

title: Use ALFRED API Documentation for Secure Apps
task: Uses the ALFRED API documentation to guide app development
summary: As a full-stack developer focused on healthcare applications, I want comprehensive and clear ALFRED API documentation that supports modern, scalable development practices, enables strict privacy adherence, and helps me build secure, accessible apps tailored to the needs of older adults.

title: Test Apps Securely in Sandbox
task: Tests the app in a sandbox environment to ensure functionality
summary: As a full-stack developer, I want to test my healthcare app in a sandbox environment that replicates real user conditions, allowing me to ensure compatibility across devices and fully respect user privacy preferences before submitting the app.
cluster: Use ALFRED API Documentation for Secure Apps

title: Secure and Compliant App Submission
task: Uploads the app to the ALFRED marketplace for review
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want tools within the ALFRED marketplace that enable me to efficiently verify privacy compliance and compatibility of my app so I can ensure it meets platform standards while aligning with my priorities for secure, accessible, and user-respecting software.

title: Verify Privacy Compliance Before App Submission
task: Verifies privacy compliance settings before submission
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to verify my app’s privacy compliance settings thoroughly before submission to ensure that I uphold my commitment to user data control and trust, align with my own standards for secure and ethical development, and avoid any setbacks in the approval process.

title: Granular Privacy Controls for App Submission
task: Considers adding granular privacy controls to address user concerns
summary: As a full-stack developer creating healthcare applications, I want to implement granular privacy settings in my apps so that I can offer users control over their data sharing preferences, helping me build trustworthy and user-centered applications that respect individual privacy needs.

title: Granular Consent Controls for App Privacy
task: Plans to implement clearer user consent prompts in the app
summary: As a developer, I want to create granular consent controls in my app that allow me to tailor privacy settings to meet older adults’ preferences and simplify their understanding and management of data sharing, ensuring I respect their autonomy while maintaining compliance with security standards.
cluster: Explicit Consent for Data Sharing in Cognitive Games
